sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a trapezium.
message_1: A trapezium has one base of length 8 cm, another base of length 14 cm, and two non-parallel sides of length 5 cm and 9 cm. What is the perimeter of the trapezium?
message_2:
To find the perimeter of the trapezium, we simply add the lengths of all four sides.

Perimeter = length of first base + length of second base + length of first non-parallel side + length of second non-parallel side

Perimeter = 8 cm + 14 cm + 5 cm + 9 cm

Perimeter = 36 cm

The perimeter of the trapezium is 36 cm.
